titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4975) to provide greater transparency with respect to lobbying activities, and for other purposes.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4975) to provide greater transparency with respect to lobbying activities, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-441, by Mr. Dreier.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4975.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 168.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 783.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Slaughter demanded the Yeas and Nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of H. Res. 783 until a later time.

vote.text: Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216 - 207 (Roll no. 110).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216 - 207 (Roll no. 110).

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4975) to provide greater transparency with respect to lobbying activities.
